awd_abstract_narration: Once a program has been written, it can be checked against its                  specification either statically (i.e. program verification) or                  dynamically (i.e. testing).  The project merges these techniques by             assuming that assertions are always checked dynamically but optimizing          away as many checks as possible.  Thus, program verification                    becomes a special case of code optimization.  Code optimization and             program verification will be linked by using the specification for              program components to optimize the programs that use them.  Program             components with specifications are likely to be faster than those               without, thus encouraging programmers to specify them.  The project             will also study how to provide performance information so that the              programmer can see how to add assertions to improve performance and             can see when components are used incorrectly.  The project will use             the TS compiler for Typed Smalltalk and the mu-ral interactive theorem          prover.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations
